newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft licenses audio, video technology.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft licenses audio, video technology.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Monday it agreed a licensing pact for Progressive Networks Inc's RealAudio and RealVideo technologies for the Internet.
The two products allow the real-time communication of audio and video signals over the Internet so computer users can communicate with voice and pictures.
Microsoft also has acquired a non-voting minority interest in Progressive Networks. Financial details were not disclosed.
Under the deal, Software giant Microsoft will license RealAudio and RealVideo 4.0 technologies and trademarks for use in its information streaming server technology, NetShow.
The companies will help define future versions of Microsoft's Active Streaming Format (ASF), and both will use ASF as the streaming format for new products.
Microsoft will include RealPlayer 4.0 and NetShow clients with Microsoft Internet Explorer, its browser software.
